metadata.title: CVE-2017-9146 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS. (noble) - low
metadata.description:
The TNEFFillMapi function in lib/ytnef.c in libytnef in ytnef through 1.9.2does not ensure a nonzero count value before a certain memory allocation,which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (heap-basedbuffer overflow and application crash) or possibly have unspecified otherimpact via a crafted tnef file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9146` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libytnef0 - 1.9.3-1
ytnef-tools - 1.9.3-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libytnef package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.9.3-1').
